website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot SX260 HS' wider, longer lens, a few much-needed design tweaks, and excellent photo quality add up to one pretty great compact megazoom.
pros: The Canon PowerShot SX260 HS has shooting modes for every type of photographer from casual to advanced, a useful long zoom lens with excellent image stabilization, and overall excellent photo and video quality for a compact megazoom
cons: The SX260 HS' menus and controls can take some getting used to, it's got a short battery life, and photos get noticeably softer-looking indoors or in low light

customer_reviews.title: we choose this particular Canon model because of its great reviews and futures
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Canon PowerShot as a gift for my sister who was visiting from Europe. She had forgotten her camera and we looked online for something affordable while not wanting to compromise on quality. Having owned anything from Nikons to Panasonics, we choose this particular Canon model because of its great reviews and futures. What can I say? It did not disappoint upon arrival and as expected this Canon took some amazing pictures. For those traveling or loving to capture the moment without a bulky camera or a larger model, I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alex K.

customer_reviews.title: Two years and still love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for over two years now, and I am still super pleased with it. It has enough manual controls if I want to tinker with it, but the portrait setting is my regular go-to for most people photos. The low-light is quite helpful indoors. For a decent, not too fancy but useful camera, this is a great choice. I especially love love love the zoom. I took close ups of my kids' swim lessons from the other side of the (big) pool. It's nice for catching candid shots without distracting the subjects since I can take the picture from a little ways away. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Miles

customer_reviews.title: Best handy travel camera
customer_reviews.text: Purchased used. First one flash did not work right. Second one was nicked up cosmetically, but takes beautiful clear photos. Kids are fast, so it's nice to get images in low light that don't blur without using a larger slower pro camera. I take this one everywhere and will be sad to have to replace it some day. Very reliable. Nice zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best low-light camera ever!
customer_reviews.text: When I travel, I take a lot of photos in low light conditions (mostly art work inside churches, etc.) and I have gone through about 3 cameras in the last few years looking for one that would do a good job on this. This one is perfect: I even took some photos in some very, very dark catacombs on Malta and they came out beautifully. It's also good for normal lighting conditions, of course; it focuses quickly and its video capacity seemed good to me. It's got a fairly wide angle for a basic camera and I was pleased with the landscape photos I took. Very, very happy with this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Canon Quality
customer_reviews.text: I took the PowerShot with me to South Africa and Botswana in order to capture some once-in-a-lifetime photos. I was not disappointed. The optical zoom got me close to a lioness and her cubs, a rhinoceros and her calf, and a herd of elephants. Fortunately, since the lens took me closer (and not our jeep) I lived to tell about it. Conversely, in civilized city locations, such as art museums or cathedrals, turning off the flash and letting natural light do the job grabbed some equally iconic photos. Canon is the gold standard. The 260 is my 3rd one. Totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Novel Man

customer_reviews.title: really liked this camera
customer_reviews.text: really liked this camera. I bought it to go to central America and travel. I didn't want to bring an slr into a less privileged environment. they tend to make you stick out more, both as a tourist and similarly, a potential victim. they can also be more difficult to carry around and id be much more upset about water damage, but that's another story. the zoom is great, one of the best at the time. having an optical zoom instead of a digital zoom was key because the digi zooms get grainy. not the case with this camera. with it had a few more functions, but for the price, its a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: bookah

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: I love traveling and now I can take quite good pictures with it during my recent vocation. It takes much better pictures than iPhone or the basic canon. I will not compare it with DLR, because I think DLR is too complicated and heavy for my simple purpose--taking nice pictures during traveling and everyday life easily. If you want to buy it, I recommend you buying an additional battery. In this way, you don't need to worry about the battery thing anymore. Something I bought together with this: (this is not advertisement, just for your convenience or comparison) 1.case  2.additional battery.  3.memory card  I am happy with all of these items!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN  Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased used. Looks and works like a new one. Very satisfied. Good price. .........Until it quick working two months after I purchased it. Lens error. Can not use the camera, lens is stuck in the full out position and camera will not turn on. I guess I learned a lesson here. There was a reason the original owner sold it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: R. T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is an amazing workhorse -- small, lightweight, reliable. So small I can easily carry it in pocket (of trousers or jacket). Has performed reliably nearly 4 yrs. Battery has been recharged innumerable times (also spare). Easy to use, with large easy-to-view screen. 20X zoom is excellent feature. Have taken hundreds (at least) of shots for professional purposes. Only downside: Often my thumb accidentally touches the Review button on right back side of camera when I'm holding it for a shot, causing me to press the button and put the camera into Review mode. I have to keep retraining myself to put my thumb elsewhere. Despite that, I'd highly recommend this particular camera.
customer_reviews.author: L_Henry

customer_reviews.title: Hooked. This is my second one.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Can't find a better camera that is not SLR. This one is larger than a cheap one but still fits in a purse or pocket. Great photos, great video, 20X zoom is enough for almost anything! This is my second because there still doesn't seem to be a better one on the market! Used up the last one all over the world!
customer_reviews.author: Cherry

customer_reviews.title: A Welcome New Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Bought the camera in anticipation of the birth of our new grandson. The camera and the baby both arrived on time and in good working condition. Thus far, neither the camera nor the baby have disappointed. Excellent, versatile camera with more features than I've had the opportunity to explore. The quality of the still pics and videos have been routinely excellent. The zoom is very powerful. Dim light imaging hasn't proven to be much of a problem. The ergonomics of the camera seem fine for me. The new mom and dad are in the process of acquainting themselves with the ergonomics of their newborn.
customer_reviews.author: Edward L. Kramer DO

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong buying a Canon Camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great portable camera to have. I accidentally dropped mine and the repair was reasonable. However, the new/replacement camera didn't have the one feature that I bought this one for. I bought this one for the GPS location tagging of the pictures. New camera had WiFi built in instead. I still like the camera, because it does excellent video's and pictures.
customer_reviews.author: DuckBoyQuinn

customer_reviews.title: A few problems..
customer_reviews.text: Tho' I am having difficulty with the date and time setting that I never had with my previous Canon Power Shot 260 HS. EG - the date was set and had been working fine. And then...the date began appearing as a day EARLIER. Have reset and am waiting to see. Have NEVER been able to get the hour and minute to appear on a photo, tho' under date and time set it indicates it's set... ???
customer_reviews.author: Betty Wiebold

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I own
customer_reviews.text: Best camera I own. This is the closest thing you will get from being a real DSLR. It's a bit bulkier than a normal compact camera, but it packs so much punch that I don't mind the size. With the 20x zoom and clarity, I was able to capture a lot of memories despite always being blocked by taller people. The pictures come out so clear even in zoom mode, people always think I have front row seats! The other functions are similar to other Canon cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Chin

customer_reviews.title: Great functional point-and-shoot camera. Great pics.
customer_reviews.text: This camera produces very good pictures considering this kind of camera. My sister had gotten one and I was impressed at the quality of pictures and ease of use. So I replaced the Nikon CoolPix I had gotten for my wife with this one because the Nikon was a clear under performer in every respect and my most disappointing camera purchase by far. My wife loves it because it is simple, just plain functions well for a typical point-and-shoot person and there is no arguing with the output. Don't see how anyone could really be disappointed with this one.
customer_reviews.author: rbengineer

customer_reviews.title: A bit awkward in size and use, but VERY good
customer_reviews.text: Great p&s camera with almost full manual control. That's good and bad. Full control is good, but doing it on a little camera like this is a bit awkward. I leave it in AV mode unless I'm shooting for speed. Lens stability is good (25-500mm equiv), but even with IS I get shake at over 350mm (about 60mm in camera). Having said that, when you want to grab a l-o-n-g shot it's just a compromise you have to live with. Photo quality is still pretty good. My only quibble is it's too big for a pocket and too small for a case. Kind of an awkward size. Still worth 5 stars if you want a small, do-everything camera.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Z

customer_reviews.title: Small, versatile, excellent quality pics, very user-friendly, easy to take great pics anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my kid for his photography class, and I was surprised by the quality of the pics that it takes, as well as how easy it is to use; although, it has a multitude of different settings that help you capture those important pics just the way you want to. So, it is packed with some great features. The zoom works well, but like most cameras in this class, push the zoom to the extreme and you cut down of course on the quality/resolution. Great camera especially for the price that you can easily take anywhere. Here are some recent shots of Varenna, Lake Como, Italy.
customer_reviews.author: Bruin Doc

customer_reviews.title: Good little camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is easy to use and does better in low light situations that my old Kodak did. I like that it videotaped in HD but be prepared for the videos to take a lot of space on your memory card because of that (a 5 minute video was almost 1 GB). I don't care for the pop-up flash because it can be annoying when you are trying to focus on a picture and I have to train myself o move my left index finger in case the flash decides to pop up.
customer_reviews.author: Stevo F

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera based on the reviews and used it literally eight times. It has never been dropped or subjected to water or anything. I only used it for special occasions. I took it to an event in Kansas City yesterday and I took it out to use it, it took two pictures and then the screen filled with snow and the camera shut down, with the lens extended. Nothing I did would correct the problem. I paid way too much for this piece of junk. NEVER AGAIN!!
customer_reviews.author: MissBonniesMom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 'Always Available' Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this small but functional camera especially as its priced to be easy to afford. I finally have the perfect 'fill in' camera between my Canon EOS Rebel T3i and my cell phone camera. Living in Alaska there is always something worth taking a picture of and the cell camera just doesn't have the optics or range of settings while the Rebel is a bit bulky to carry everywhere I go. The PowerShot SX260 is a great way to fill this gap! I have yet to try the video but then I largely purchased the unit to handle still images...
customer_reviews.author: Bill Was

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small camera
customer_reviews.text: Had the same camera before. It fits nicely in my pocket for quick shots around the ranch, or when I'm riding in interesting situations. It was a little more expensive than I remembered, but I guess that's the way it goes. I'd recommend it to anyone who wants a nice little camera for convenience that fits easily in a pocket and is out of the way. Takes nice pictures.
customer_reviews.author: New to Brown & Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera when it first came out. Liked it so much I bought one for my daughter. Took camera on Alaska cruise. Saw all these "camera buffs" with their long lens and very large HEAVY gadget bags. One night we were all comparing shots taken. My camera took the best pictures. I could zoom in and quickly get that shot of a whale's tale hitting the water. I even got a shot of ice caving off a glacier. The pictures could easily compete for spots in a travel magazine. There is a learning curve to take advantage of all the features this camera has to offer but well worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a two week trip to South America. It performed admirably with the only drawback being my lack of practice in everything it has to offer. The 20x optical zoom is fantastic. The geometry, casing material, and overall feel is terrific. I took over 8,000 photos and video clips over the two weeks without a hiccup. I used a 16gb SanDisk card, downloaded files every evening and never missed a shot. I went through batteries like crazy. Always had one in the camera, one in my pocket and another charging. Don't know if this is unusual. Now my wife wants one.
customer_reviews.author: Lonesome George, RIP

customer_reviews.title: Lens Defect
customer_reviews.text: Good camera, solid build.. A bit higher now than when I bought it. However, I have had it since last August, we'll it was a gift for my wife, and she hasn't used it much but I broke it out the other day and noticed a black spot on the screen which is obviously coming from a lens defect. I took several shots and it's always there.I can't slam the camera but I just got a bad one. And it is too late to do anything.. I lost money on the purchase but can't tell anyone not to buy one.
customer_reviews.author: DRICH8990

customer_reviews.title: This Camera is for everybody! ...
customer_reviews.text: I always remember a professional photographer telling me that anybody who is not a professional photographer should always invest in buying a good camera. The reason being, a professional photographer could use almost any camera to take a good picture; the non-professional needs the help of the camera. After reviewing the pics taken by a friend and complimenting her on her skill she referred me to the Canon Powershot SX260. Of course I googled the reviews and immediately bought it as a birthday gift for my daughter who travels a lot and was always complaining about her "messed-up" pics. She LOVES her Canon Powershot SX260!
customer_reviews.author: BlackPudding

customer_reviews.title: Best to lug around... for quality.
customer_reviews.text: You can't carry your DSLR around your neck all the time. This is the least bulky (compact) of the Canon cameras you can buy with the best quality of pictures. Very handy for those instant/quick shots and easy to carry around in the pocket or purse. Flash placement is on the wrong spot, though, where we usually touch when holding it up with both hands to take a pic... so the flash tries to come up (in low-light environment) but you're pushing down on it. You would end up needing a re-take, & sometimes you can't afford to do that, or it's too late. Otherwise, 'love the video mode in full HD!
customer_reviews.author: Paige Polley

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: For high quality photos, I have lugged my DSLR and a number of lenses with me on trips. Having read the reviews from a number of other amateur photographers, I thought I would take a chance and give the SX260 a try on my next trip. WOW!!! I have to say I was totally impressed. Rather than regurgitate the fine details my fellow photographers so eloquently explained, I'll just say that I concur wholeheartedly. I will no longer need to lug my heavy camera bag around on trips. Instead, I can simply place this totally awesome, fully capable camera into my pocket knowing I won't miss a single fantastic shot.
customer_reviews.author: VSMO

customer_reviews.title: Powershot SX260HS
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera. - Bought as a Christmas present for my parents. I have owned a number of point and shoot cameras over the years, and will only buy canon powershots, I've owned 5 small digital cameras over the last 12 years, and will now only buy powershots. - (I do own nikon DSLR though) Very nice camera. - easy to use (as they upgraded from an earlier powershot) My only criticism; the flash pops out of the top of the camera when needed. - pain in the rear - it's exactly where you hold the camera. they should have stuck with leaving it on the front, rather than adding un-needed complexity. Great zoom - 20X optical.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this camera. It takes beautiful pictures, is the right size, the batteries last forever, the screen is huge, and it has some nice options. I did though just set it to "portrait" mode permanently, even for a lot of scenery shots, it seems to make the pictures more brilliant than the auto mode. The only complaint would be the pop-up flash being in a position where you naturally put your left index finger, I've had the camera for months now and am still not used to it and occasionally my finger is over it. I'm afraid I'm going to break the mechanism one of these days, but so far it's been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: This camera is fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because it was highly rated and had alot of features for the price range. I need this camera for a digital photography course I am taking this semester. I love that there is an auto function that takes great pics and that there are tons of manual features that I can play around with - such as having the camera put everything in black and white instead of one color. It adds character to the photo. I am not a professional by any means but I am going to learn and for learning, I could not have gotten a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to believe the the pictures this little camera can take. It has the ability to zoom in incredibly far without compromising image quality, and the 'Auto' settings are very easy to use. Image stabilization is near-perfect. I take all my pictures hand-held, and I never miss a shot. I've taken ~300 photos in the week that I've had it, and not a single one had to be deleted or re-done. Images can get a little grainy in low-light without a flash (on 'Auto'), but the night time scene works really well. If you're looking for a hand-held point and shoot that takes amazing pictures, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley J.

customer_reviews.title: This camera comes with a battery charger that has a ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera comes with a battery charger that has a separate cord rather than a flip plug on the charger. This was a deal-breaker for me, as there is no reason to have to carry a separate cord when most every other camera is available with a single unit for charging the battery. I called Cannon and was told that this is a European model, as the USA models have the flip-style chargers without need for a separate cord. Needless to say, I am returning the camera, as Amazon has not been able to come up with a USA model in this color (green) with the single unit charger.
customer_reviews.author: plr66

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a camera guru by any means. I am mostly a "point, zoom, shoot" girl, but so far this camera is wonderful. The quality of the pictures is amazing - clear and sharp. I want to expand my use and really get to USE the features offered, but as I said, "So far, so good". One of the main reasons I chose this was the size. I wanted a pocket size camera that still offered good quality and this really fits the bill. It is a good weight; sturdy but not heavy, and it will fit into my coat pocket when I want. I will recommend this camera to any novice to mid camera user.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. F. H.

customer_reviews.title: Ehh, it's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Not the most user-friendly camera we have owned (and we have owned about 7 or 8 in the past few years), but it does the trick. If you are used to using two hands to hold the camera...which I think most people are, this camera gets a little annoying because if you have your left hand in the upper right corner and you want to use the flash it won't come up. So you have to turn the camera all the way off and then turn it on again to have it re-boot. That gets a little annoying. It's not a bad camera, but for the price I was expecting something a little easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera. Good Job Canon
customer_reviews.text: I'm partial to Canon systems in the SLR and DSLR format, and I have to say that this Point and Shoot did not disappoint. The image quality is great and there are plenty of auto features as well as manual ones for tinkering and getting the shots you want. Great battery life. Small enough to carry in a coat pocket or small belt case. I've taken this from South Africa to South Carolina and I have never had a problem or failed to capture an image I wanted. Great camera that I will have for years of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Camera
customer_reviews.text: Researched cameras extensive before selecting this make and model as a gift to my wife who has several non-digital slr cameras with some expensive lenses for a variety of shooting needs and conditions. This camera is always available and readily at hand and is a lot less expensive as far as the costs of ending up with a finished print. She still has her other cameras for extensive photography sessions or planned projects but this one gives her unlimited opportunities for that "perfect photo if only I had my camera with me situations".
customer_reviews.author: Obsidiona

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our European trip and found it to be a great little camera. It has lots of useful features, yet the programs yield excellent pictures if you don't have the time or willingness to fiddle around. It is nicely compact and fits easily into the pocket. We got a lot of photos from each charge, but I'd always recommend a spare battery or two for particularly heavy days. I've even taken it to airshows for static shots when I don't wish to change lenses on my big DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!  Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I had another Canon Power Shot before and was happy with it. Unfortunately I lost it. So I did my research and came to the conclusion of buying another more up to date Canon Power Shot. I was not disappointed! The colors and clarity of the pictures are great. The camera does reduce movements which will make your pictures sharper. The only flaw the camera has is that the pop up flash is located at the very top where we are all used to holding it. You must remember not to put your finger on the pop flash preventing the flash from popping up. Honestly you will get used to not putting your finger on pop flash.
customer_reviews.author: sunny

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for an overseas trip and, with a few easy adjustments in a photo editing program to compensate for light issues, the photos were every bit as good as those taken by the other people in our group who had expensive cameras with big lenses and sunshades. Very easy to use and the controls and settings are pretty much self-explanatory. Only complaint is that the software that came with the camera was useless and out of date/incompatible with my computer. I simply downloaded a PDF of the instruction book and that made the CD even more useless, since the camera can be used with any photo program.
customer_reviews.author: KMD

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular little camera!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had finally had it with my Kodak easyshare that I just purchased last year. It was clumsy to handle and I was forever recharging batteries. It used 4 AA rechargeable batteries and my new Canon Super Shot uses a lithium battery. The AA batteries took 11 1/2 hours to charge! The lithium battery takes a little less than 1 1/2 hour!!!!! That was the main reason that I purchased this camera. The other reason was that the comments for the Canon Super Shot were overwhelmingly positive and just what I was looking for in quality and price. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.B

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera to take photos of my grandsons' band concerts. I appreciate all the reviewers who led me to choose this camera. It is easy to focus, download to my computer and the software is easy to use. The colors in the viewer when I'm taking the picture are not accurate in the pink/purple range. But the computer image was fine. Taking pictures of butterflies was somewhat frustrating because there is a time lag before I can take another shot. I just learned to work with this, because overall it meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: careful shopper

customer_reviews.title: I love my Canon PowerShot!
customer_reviews.text: This point-and-shoot not only takes high-quality pictures but is also easy to use and has a good variety of standard features. Zoom quality is better than expected, and low-light image quality is excellent. The only problem is a somewhat awkward position for the flash when it pops up, but that is a very minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: Takes Good Pictures in ideal Environment, but Not Low Light Friendly.
customer_reviews.text: This camera claims to be able to take great pictures under low light environments, but after use I see that the pictures lose a lot of focus and sharpness. When taking video it is even worse, I've had galaxy cellphones take better quality video under low light conditions. The zoom is very good however and there are many settings to get a good shot, keep in mind however that some settings require time for the camera to take a clear shot (slow frame shutter) and can result in out of focus images if you take fast action.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: First Canon Since my AE-1
customer_reviews.text: This camera is Great for taking Pictures outside! This is the First Canon Camera I've owed since my Canon AE-1 and my Canon T-50, both were great camera's! I Like the Smaller SX260HS Much better, because its lighter than my older cameras! I am Not a Professional Picture Taker, I Just Enjoy taking Pictures for my from to Northern California from were I was born there! I also love taking Pictures of Oregon Now were I live. There are many beautiful Places in the USA to Visit. I am Still Learning how to use my newer SX260HS right now. Take Care Everyone! ~Kristi
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Good little camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd PowerShot camera. I loved the first one so much, I stuck with it and would update every few years as newer models come out. Love the nice big screen. Great number of features even in auto mode - more than enough for your every day photos. very happy with quality of pics so far (3 months of constant use, taking pics of new baby) The flash pops out and ends up a little in the way of trigger finger. The on/off button is weirdly positioned - it is sunk in the camera and it takes me several presses every time to turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: iberian

customer_reviews.title: A good camera with all the important features.
customer_reviews.text: Good camera, enjoy the long zoom. Plenty of features. I've used similar Canon cameras so operation was not a problem. I do have a problem with the color reproduction in many photos however. They just seem a bit off. In particular the greens are very unnatural particularly in vivid mode. In certain situations and lighting and certain settings, the colors are really not very realistic. But overall it's good, particularly for outdoor shots in plenty of light.
customer_reviews.author: Buster Brown

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I am far from being a professional photographer, but read the reviews by those that are both amateur and professional, resulting in my purchase. This is a fantastic camera as it allows me to point and shoot or to adjust the settings as needed. I am super impressed by the zoom features as many of the shots I take are of rescue animals and can't get toooo close to them. I have only had this a few days, but am finding it hard to put down. The ease of use and clarity of the photos are absolutely key. Price is much better on Amazon than on Canon direct. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen L. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Little PHD Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my wife to upgrade her from an older PowerShot. She has used it with almost an odd fervor since unwrapping it. Sandisk cannot make enough Class 10 SD cards to keep up with her voracious appetite for clicking. It takes great pictures for a camera in its price range. She especially loves the rapid fire feature and the HD video recording feature. This camera has been a real asset on our vacations and for chronically the first year of our youngest child's life. Highly recommended. Just be sure you buy a Class 10 card for it to unlock its full potential.
customer_reviews.author: S. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Quality at the right price
customer_reviews.text: We used our most recent family vacation as an excuse to upgrade our digital camera. We had neither the budget nor interest to invest in an expensive DSLR model - we wanted high quality pictures in a point-and-shoot form factor. The PowerShot SX260 fit our needs perfectly. Clear, crisp pictures and HD video, all worlds better than our typical smartphone pictures. The only reservation I have about giving the PowerShot SX260 five stars is the clunky interface and slow response time overall. For the feature set available I would expect an onboard processor up to the task.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Ringworm

customer_reviews.title: Wrong battery and charger
customer_reviews.text: It came with the wrong battery and charger. The battery basically rattles around and the the contacts don't even line-up. Aces. So who the heck knows how the camera works (if it works at all)?
customer_reviews.author: Hold Steady

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with a few shortcomings
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed using this camera for a couple of weeks. Good quality photos in general. The position of the flash is unfortunate, however. The flash pops up in the upper left corner and the first few times I obstructed it by my way of holding the camera. The camera must be held without touching the upper left corner or you can damage the flash mechanism. Strange design. Otherwise it has plenty of features and powerful zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Korzenny

customer_reviews.title: Something is jacked on the screen
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera on black friday in 2012. I had to replace it within a month because it was having issues. Amazon was great about the replacing it (replaced in January), but the replacement camera also developed problems that progressively got worse. There is something wrong with the screen -- like there are lines across it -- so I can't tell if I have a good picture or not. the same problem now happens when reviewing the pictures taken. Unfortunately it can't be returned now. It's been less than a year. This is the worst camera I've had.
customer_reviews.author: HILDI P.

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect
customer_reviews.text: Best camera I own. Pics are much better than my SLR and without the bulk of course (and with a much larger zoom range). My only gripe is that it is not good for shots of the stars (can't get the long, open shutter speed needed) and have limited aperture range, but this is to be expected of any compact camera. So basically, great for taking anywhere (even Africa) without dealing with the bulk of an SLR, with the same or better quality pics.
customer_reviews.author: kristi

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for a great price
customer_reviews.text: The 20x optical zoom is amazing and I like that it's only 12.1 megapixels, because it saves on memory and you really don't need more unless you're making giant posters. Also, once I got used to hitting the video record button instead of rotating the dial, it makes shooting videos much faster. It is slightly too large to be a pocket camera, but I use my smartphone for spur of the moment pictures anyway. A great addition is the timer selection where it takes 3 pictures in succession, about a second apart. It's kinda like a photo booth! So far I love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Roberta S

customer_reviews.title: No better camera for the money, ever.
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap this is a good camera. I have a dSLR Nikon D5000 I routinely use. While the Nikon can take great pictures and has the ability to change lenses, etc. I would almost always rather take pictures with this camera or take it on trips. The image stabilization is fantastic. Really awesome pictures, really easy to point and shoot. Slight oversaturation on colors like many Canons (but that probably makes pictures more appealing anyway). We'll definitely always buy and keep a camera from this series of powershots.
customer_reviews.author: Bret Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Worse Audio I have ever Heard
customer_reviews.text: If you are serious about acceptable audio steer clear of this camera. The pictures are good to very good and the video is also good to very good, but the slightest bit of high volume audio such as drums at a concert or a loud preacher will distort the audio so badly that you can't even use it. It's not just my camera either. I have discovered several others online that have experienced the same thing. You can hear an example here:  I wasted my hard earned money for a camera to shoot HD video, because the results are unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera thinking on cost benefit and quality that it could give me. I thought it would not be so good, but as I was looking for something good and reasonably priced, I decided to buy it. The fact is that I was surprised with the machine, simply the best I've had so far, if we talk in size and segment (point and shoot). I strongly recommend this machine. Pros: The battery life is excellent, takes sharp pictures with vivid colors and no ghosting. Cons: so far, no.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great stylish camera, does a wonderful job
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera, very easy to use with spectacular shots. Can be simple point and shoot or very versatile for someone with more knowledge. Only downside is all that power eats the battery relatively quickly, so I bought a few spares (they're pretty cheap if not name brand)
customer_reviews.author: Jayson G.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: oh my oh my this is camera is so great. i am always being complimented on my photos and i'm a point and shoot person. lots of people have asked me what camera i use (and in fact a friend bought the same one). i don't need a lot in my camera but i love the zoom and have really enjoyed getting top notch, professional (dare i say it?) photos. we even have some hanging on our wall they've turned out so well. LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.author: humphie

customer_reviews.title: I Love my Canon!!!
customer_reviews.text: Originally i purchased the canon Sx260 and loved it. Bought it before thanksgiving so i can take photos of the family. I Loved it, but then i started hearing the rave about the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX20V and decided to return my canon and try the Sony out. The Sony is a good camera and has the water effect which i really loved. But for me it was never better than my Canon. I liked the Sony, I loved my canon. So i returned it and went back to my baby!! (Canon) It has met my needs.....what more can i ask for. I highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: M.N.

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok. But unnecessary if you have a new iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: I compare it to my new iPhone, and I wish I never bought it bc the iPhone takes just as good pictures.
customer_reviews.author: happybuyer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera! I have a Nikon D3100 DSLR, which is too bulky for my tastes for a lot of picture taking on the go, and I have been very pleased with Canon's point and shoot cameras. I used this one the first time at our local butterfly show and took beautiful pictures that I am thrilled with. Also used it for pictures of the kids going to prom--again, took some wonderful portraits and candid shots. It's very easy to use, and just the right weight in my hand, although maybe too heavy for your pocket. It does use a rechargeable battery and not AAs.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa E. Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Sent first one back due to it having an electronic ...
customer_reviews.text: Sent first one back due to it having an electronic failure straight out of the box. The second one has been yet another miserable failure! When you press the button to take a picture you must wait several seconds before the camera "auto focuses" and actually snaps the picture! By the time the picture is actually snapped my toddler has left the room! Would never buy again!
customer_reviews.author: nunyabusiness

customer_reviews.title: great for a while
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved everything about this camera... until the screen went black on me... I can still take and upload pictures from the memory card, but I cant use the screen to see how i need to adjust lighting settings... and the camera is NO GOOD in dark settings... I will put on every light in my house... during the day, and I still can't get enough light with any decent shutter speed without using icky flash... but great outdoor day photos
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This little camera was exactly what I was looking for, so glad I got one before they are all gone! Canon has discontinued this model, but you can still get the SX280 at a higher cost and a few more options. I had purchased the SX150, but returned it... I didn't like anything about that camera and especially the fact that the batteries died super fast. This SX260 is the DSLR users "small go to camera" in my book! Great product... thanks Amazon and thanks Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: so far, we love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for teen daughter. We have always had great luck with Canon products, and I could not find a bad review on this camera. This PowerShot has exceeded our expectations. Takes wonderful pictures and is easy to use. I really am pleased with the zoom lens, we recently attended a concert and even from upper balcony we got great shots and video footage. I am feeling a bit guilty, as i have borrowed this gift several times, finding it much more convenient than my big expensive camera, and really not seeing much difference in the quality. We were also thrilled with the quick shipping, ordered with 2-day shipping, and received in less than 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Mag

customer_reviews.title: canon powershot sx260 hs
customer_reviews.text: I just got my new camera from Amazon. I love the auto focus feature and the quality of the pictures so far are great even at distances. I had bought my daughter a canon PowerShot for Christmas and was amazed at the quality of the recording of my grandsons soccer game! So when my old camera died after less than a couple of years use, The Canon PowerShot was the only one I looked at to purchase. Of course I had to have the 1080 pixel instead of the 720 pixel I got her so my Video quality should be better...Thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like the picture quality of this camera
customer_reviews.text: I really like the picture quality of this camera. So far, I've just used it in auto mode, and have been really pleased, but I'm looking forward to sitting down and figuring out how all of the other features work.
customer_reviews.author: Laura K

customer_reviews.title: Missing warranty system booklet and  "Getting Started"  booklet
customer_reviews.text: Today I ran the Manuals Disk EUR1126.0 and read that I was supposed to receive two booklets, "warranty system" and "getting started." NOT so. How do I go about acquiring these? Otherwise, everything seems to be there and I'm getting a grad student to help me ..... this camera is pretty high tech for a senior citizen! ~Anne Johnson Potsdam, NY
customer_reviews.author: Anne H. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: point and shoot mega zoom
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I didn't want to spend a lot, but I wanted to try out a simple mega zoom point and shoot camera. Obviously it can't deliver what more expensive cameras can. Reviews recommended this camera in the price range I wanted, so I bought it. Happy with it and very much enjoying the 20X capability. Taking mostly bird shots in good sunlight. Quality looks very good when blown up in Aperture. My goal is not for prints but for web presentations and lectures in PowerPoint or its equivalent. Using a monopod to steady the camera even though it has stabilizing software.
customer_reviews.author: David F. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Black lies in screen
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for 14 months. Today the screen has black lines all through it. Called Canon and they want $147 to repair it. I paid $284 for it 9/2012. Since I've seen other reviewers mention this problem, I believe after years of using Canon products, it's time to move on. Just beware of this potential problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great compact package
customer_reviews.text: I would definately recommend this camera. Loaded with plenty of features and excellent picture quality (even in lower light, thanks to back-lit CMOS sensor). HD-Movie quality actually surpasses my ditgital camcorder. This camera is a lot smaller than our old one and it took a little bit to get used to holding it correctly without interfering with the camera's automatic flash. LCD screen is large and easy to see. This camera is very convenient to cary everywhere and takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: LambsWool

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this years ago and I still use and love my camera even though I take photos of my phone
customer_reviews.author: Diana S.

customer_reviews.title: Love my Canon SX260
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my Canon SX200 I loved. This SX260 has even greater zoom and is smaller in size. But not so small as to make it awkward for my arthritic fingers. The smile feature for group shots is really nice! For my price range this is a perfect upgrade. The special features look like fun, but I haven't used them yet. I was pleased with the fast delivery. I was leaving for a trip to the Tetons in 2 days and the promised delivery date was achieved. Taking quality pictures was easy since it was so similar to my Canon SX200.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley

customer_reviews.title: I like this.
customer_reviews.text: I've always like canon, so when I order this one to replace my old canon I was excited,downside of this camera has low performance of battery drained that fast. The I hate the software that come with it. After installing ImageBrowser Ex I cxant even opened it because it has a conflict the Microsoft silverlight. When I called canon help desk they said they been having a lot of problem with this and they are trying to fixed it.Oh and if you are using windows it and trying to installed this you have to go to canon website to get that version.Aside from that everything else was good.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: Love. Love. Love. This camera is simple, has a fabulous zoom, has plenty of great settings. You can do more with it than I do, but even my hubbie (who is camera savvy) loves it. The colors are beautiful, pictures are clear. I often take photos of kids and animals, so it is wonderful to have a camera that can catch them inside and out!
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Great step-up from an older Powershot model
customer_reviews.text: I really like Canon camera products, and had an older Powershot that I'm upgrading from as I had the other camera for years now, and it was time! Well, this camera is a great step-up from that with excellent quality images, great zoom capabilities, and for the beginner user, even an "easy use" setting that helps you out! For the advanced user, you can still program things to your desire as well. Love it- even when trying to photograph indoors without flash and kids on the go, it works well for me!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: fabulous small camera
customer_reviews.text: I take pictures of family and wildlife and this little camera is perfect. The 20x optical zoom lets me catch the animals outside our back door and still takes beautiful indoor pictures. The only con is the location of the flash, but I've gotten used to that and take most of my pictures without flash anyway. There are lots of features that I don't even know about yet, but that just makes it even more interesting. I would recommend this camera to anyone wanting a powerful camera that is small enough to carry with you anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera it is really good camera very good pictures came in on time I think it was a very good value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased another camera, a more expensive one, but wasn't happy with the sixe. I wanted one small enough to fit into my purse. This not only fits, but it turns out that it's a better camera than the more expensive one.This is perfect in every way. I recommend this to every one. Pair it with Case Logic TBC-302 FFP Compact Camera Case and you've got the perfect pair. I don't know if I'm allowd to say that or not, but it'll save you some time in looking for the case that fits perfectly and is small and soft..
customer_reviews.author: beachsand

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera !
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Really really really great clear crisp pictures. It has an 80x zoom and those pictures and great too. I used it at to take photos of Kenny Chesney on stage at the Houston Rodeo from the top level - and it looks like you are 10 feet away - still a good clear picture. I take tons of photos now. It has a live mode so I was able to use it during my daughters high school drill team performance without having to have the flash and could zoom in on her alone. Definitely more than worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: ROBYSMOM

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot Camera.
customer_reviews.text: Terrific zoom lens, great photos! compact in size, easy to use without all the bulk. Lightweight. I like the Aqua color. Makes it easy to spot than the traditional black. So far, I really like it. Haven't used the movie function yet. I suggest you store it in a pouch/sleeve carrier. Not dropped into a purse or pocket. That will damage the lens protector. I love the automatic turn off function. Battery recharges fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Schatziekins

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning Lens Cover
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes excellent pictures but is extremely delicate. I keep this camera in a pelican case, and take it out in benign conditions for shooting nature scenes. The camera functioned well through about 100 pictures, after which the lens cover fails to open and close. To take a picture, you then have to manually slide the lens cover open. This is a fatal design flaw and I would not recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Capdeville

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I have it otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Shutter time is a bit slow but the quality of pictures and videos are a real step up from my old camera. I also have issues with the software it comes with. I had to upload it again after we bought a new laptop and after that I could not crop, reduce red eyes, sharpen images etc. any longer. I have to look into this issue that I did not have with my old Nikon camera. Any way, I am glad I have it otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: As for any Canon, this is a great camera for the higher end of the amateur breed. I have an SX230 for myself (I bought this one for my sister), which is also great. I bought this one thinking that it was just a 230 with better zoom, but in addition it packs some additional goodies. Not enough to make me upgrade mine, tough... Summary: it is a great camera for its price range. As with any Canon, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Feanor

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Long-time fan of Cannon cameras vs Nikon, in regards to the small digital ones. Frankly, I will never buy a Digital (small) Nikon Camera ever again. Cheaply made. Terrible lens. Plastic. This Cannon has been great for the point-and shoot. Nice Zoom. Easy to use. It is a little larger than (comfortable) pocket-size for me, but well-made, nice-sized screen, nice features. Works great for this price range.
customer_reviews.author: eposner

customer_reviews.title: Love the 20x zoom!
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful camera . . . I'd been using (and still do use) my Canon S90, and bought the new camera only because I wanted a more powerful zoom. This one has it! You can shoot distant birds, flowers, etc. with remarkable detail and quality. The only drawback (easily overcome, of course) is that the on/off button is placed so that, removing the camera from a belt holster, there's a tendency to push the button (and turn the camera on) when retrieving the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Best camera we've owned
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this purchase. We bought a new camera when we found out we were pregnant. I am so glad we bought this one!! This camera takes such crisp pictures. We are especially happy with picture quality in low light. The pictures don't come out blurry or dark, as with other cameras we've owned. I would say the only thing we don't like is the green light that comes out before taking pictures with flash, the baby always comes out with a startled look. But that was easily solved by turning off the flash with a press of a button, or better yet shooting in discreet mode.
customer_reviews.author: M. Paz

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Its a great camera, at least for my purposes. I love taking close up shots (especially of nature)so the zoom is perfect. One problem is that when you zoom in, you must hold your breath so that the picture does not come out blurry. The shutter speed is extremely fast. So you usually end up with the picture you wanted plus an extra shot, maybe of the grass that was surrounding that deer. But otherwise with a little more practice I'm sure this camera will be perfect......
customer_reviews.author: AnaB

customer_reviews.title: This is one great camera!!
customer_reviews.text: Takes great pictures. Had to get used to holding it differently since the flash is on top. I put my left thumb on side of camera and my index finger under the lense and tip of index touching the bottom of the rubber strip. This keeps the camera from falling forward. Hope this helps someone. Bought the Wasabi charger with two 1300mha batteries. They last forever and the charger comes with car battery attachment. This one solid camera and look forward to using a lot of its capabilities,
customer_reviews.author: Cedarcrab

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace a Nikon Coolpix camera that stopped working properly after a year and three months. This is a great point and shoot camera and very easy to use and set up. I recommend this camera to anyone who wants an easy, affordable point and shoot. I did try the video camera, the picture is wonderful and you can hear focus adjusting, but nothing out of the ordinary that I haven't encountered using other video recording devices. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neat little PaS
customer_reviews.text: Insane zoom on this thing. Makes my DSLRs jealous, especially with how little it weighs. It makes some very nice photos, especially in the right hands. Great for a little PaS to walk around with or to make yourself look touristy so people won't be unnerved when you start taking photos. Sometimes people don't like it when you whip out a pro-body camera with a two foot lens... or any pro-body. Suddenly, you're a terrorist or predator. Whacky.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for several years now, and I am still very happy with it. Has a great zoom and picture quality for a point and shoot. I've always wanted a bigger camera... but I have never gotten one, because I love that this one can conveniently fit in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: HollyMarie

customer_reviews.title: Good travel camera
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, especially for travel when I want a good pic and long telephoto capabilities without carrying my DSLR and lenses.
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: Stunning quality digital pictures
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera so that I could improve the overall quality of the pictures I take. I also wanted to be able to mess around with SLR features, but wanted the ease of a point and shoot camera. This little beauty allows me to do both. The quality of the images is amazing and whenever I want and can change the settings to allow the camera to function more manually with shutter speed, aperature etc. The price as compared to other quality point and shoots was phenom!! Tip: Use of a tri-pod for extreme zoom is recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: JDoyle

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Used this in Europe this summer, takes great photos. There is a bit of a learning curve on this and I had to look up many things like taking panoramic photos but once you read about it it it pretty easy. So it is not overly intuitive but you can figure it out. I also LOVE the GPS function, when loaded on my ipad I can see the London photos separate from the Nice or Paris photos etc. That is the one function that I would not want to give up or turn off on the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Estero, FL resident

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this camera...perfect for family pictures
customer_reviews.text: I got this to be able to capture my toddler in motion and it is fantastic. It focuses and takes the pictures quickly, allowing you to capture the perfect shots. I know very little about cameras, but the pictures turn out perfect. It is fully automated for someone like me, but has manual features for someone who would know what they were doing. I wish I would have gotten one sooner. I haven't had it long (3 weeks?), but I think I've taken more pictures than I have in the last year with my old one. It's a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good,I'am happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a nice all purpose pocket camera. Love the zoom, takes good pics and video. Actually heavier than I thought it would be. Did not really hear the whine during video( I am a bit hard of hearing so maybe) but you can hear the zoom. I read reviews so knew about some noise using video, they are less than thought they would be. Battery is OK, but if you are going to shot very much video in a day, I'd recommend an extra battery. All in all, I am happy with it and could recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dianna318

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera and its certainly capturing all my memories ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera and its certainly capturing all my memories so well here! It is very compact so packs well in my pants pocket during hikes or in my daypack. Took it with me on a cruise to see glaciers and took outstanding photos! many great features and takes excellent photos! So much to see and capture in photos here in Alaska, this camera does a phenomenal job!
customer_reviews.author: ALASKA WILDMAN

customer_reviews.title: This camera is mostly just a great value
customer_reviews.text: The range of conditions the camera will handle is great. Being shock resistant is a big plus. I accidentally dropped it about 3 feet to a wood floor. You can imagine my horrified reaction, but there was no apparent damage and it worked fine. The only things I wish they would change for future renditions of this model would be to allow exposure compensation for high speed video, that is greater than 30 frames per sec. and offer a mode for time lapse photography.
customer_reviews.author: AlexPJ-Digital_since_1982

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SX260 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 20x Image Stabilized Zoom 25mm Wide-Angle Optical Lens and 1080p HD Video (Red) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Color:Red| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Canon 6195B100 PowerShot SX260 HS 12.1MP Compact Digital Camera, in red, is an ultra-slim camera with a powerful 20x Optical Zoom, Optical Image Stabilization and 25mm Wide-Angle lens but that is only the beginning of its attractions. You will see detail you never thought possible through the huge zoom and wide-angle lens, while the camera's 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS Sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor deliver the rich, clear low-light performance that is the hallmark of Canon's HS SYSTEM. 1080p Full HD video in stereo is more beautiful than ever, with new high-resolution, high-speed processing. Sophisticated advancements include improved Smart AUTO that optimizes settings for 58 predefined shooting situations, Face ID that prioritizes pre-registered faces, and GPS for tracking and recording your shooting locations.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

CAPTURE IT ALL
The fact that the PowerShot SX260 HS digital camera is an ultra-slim camera with a powerful 20x Optical Zoom, Optical Image Stabilization and 25mm Wide-Angle lens is only the beginning of its attractions. You'll see detail you never thought possible through the huge zoom and wide-angle lens, while the camera's 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS Sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor deliver the rich, clear low-light performance that is the hallmark of Canon's HS SYSTEM. 1080p Full HD video in stereo is more beautiful than ever, with new high-resolution, high-speed processing. Sophisticated advancements include improved Smart AUTO that optimizes settings for 58 predefined shooting situations, Face ID that prioritizes pre-registered faces, and GPS for tracking and recording your shooting locations.

ASTONISHINGLY SLIM
ULTRA-SLIM CAMERA WITH POWERFUL 20X OPTICAL ZOOM, OPTICAL IMAGE STABILIZATION AND 25MM WIDE-ANGLE LENS 
At just over 1-1/4 inches thick, the PowerShot SX260 HS is an ultra-slim digital camera with a powerful 20x Optical Zoom. But because its lens embodies the quality and legacy of Genuine Canon Optics, its advantages go far beyond making the camera slim enough to slip in your pocket and carry anywhere. With a range of 25mm â€“ 500mm (35mm equivalent), the lens gives you the power to capture the full breadth of scenes, with details you've never captured before. Images are bright and vivid with spectacular clarity thanks to Optical Image Stabilization.



OPTICAL IMAGE STABILIZER
Handheld shooting can often lead to camera shake, making photos and videos blurry. Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer is a sophisticated system that uses lens-shift technology to correct unwanted camera movement. It makes handheld photography more practical, providing excellent image quality in many difficult shooting situations: outdoors at dusk, inside without a flash, and even at the telephoto end of the zoom range without a tripod. For photos, it enables shooting at slower shutter speeds, accommodating more low-light shooting situations than ever before without having to boost ISO sensitivity. With camera shake and vibration reduced, you get a sharper, steadier image. And because it is an optical system, there is none of the image degradation typical with electronic image stabilizers.

UA LENS TECHNOLOGY
Pioneered by Canon, UA Lens technology makes possible compact lenses with remarkable optical performance. By using molded glass with an ultra-high refractive index in aspherical lens elements, Canon has succeeded in reducing lens size while significantly reducing image aberrations. Another stellar example of cutting-edge Canon optics, UA Lens technology helps make PowerShot digital cameras pocket-friendly and capable of astounding image quality. EXPERIENCE THE POWER
CANON HS SYSTEM
The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you take bright, clear photos in an even wider range of shooting situations. Beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The system is the result of two technologies brought together in PowerShot cameras: a high-sensitivity imaging sensor, which is able to capture more light; and the DIGIC 5 Image Processor, which actively reduces noise with high-speed image processing. The 12.1 Megapixel Canon CMOS sensor in the PowerShot SX260 HS incorporates advanced light reception technology that enhances sensitivity. The DIGIC 5 Image Processor provides a major boost in noise reduction, expanding the usable ISO range to an amazing high of ISO 3200. The Canon HS SYSTEM thus lets you use higher shutter speeds to capture clearer images with reduced noise and blur.

CANON DIGIC 5 IMAGE PROCESSOR 
The latest-generation Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor brings phenomenal increases in processing speed and power. Improved chip architecture and algorithms deliver greatly expanded functionality with further refinement in image quality. Improved noise reduction produces clearer images when shooting in low light at high ISO speeds. Enhanced i-Contrast performance adjusts differences between light and dark areas to achieve even more natural-looking results. The faster processing speed also results in faster continuous shooting capability while maintaining full image quality. The DIGIC 5 Image Processor also makes possible a new, highly advanced automatic white balance system. Whereas conventional white balance makes an overall adjustment based on a single type of light source, the new Canon Multi-Area White Balance analyzes several areas of the image to determine whether different adjustments are needed, for example, for the main subject and the background.

MEMORABLE MOMENTS IN SPECTACULAR FULL HD
CANON FULL HD VIDEO ADVANTAGE 
In addition to the Canon HS SYSTEM, the combination of the advanced CMOS sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor in the PowerShot SX260 HS makes it possible to shoot crisp, clear high definition video. Imagine the fun and excitement of being able to shoot spectacular 1080p Full HD video with stereo sound that you can later watch on your HDTV or download to your computer to share with family and friends. In addition to being able to shoot Full HD 1080p video at 24* frames per second, the PowerShot SX260 HS can also shoot 720p HD video at 30** frames per second.

DEDICATED MOVIE BUTTON, WIND FILTER FEATURE AND OPTICAL ZOOM FOR EASY VIDEO CAPTURE 
Itâ€™s never been easier to shoot videos with a PowerShot digital camera. The PowerShot SX260 HS has a dedicated movie button that lets you start and stop recording instantly. There is no need to go through layers of menus or operate switches or dials to switch to and from video recording mode. The camera is always ready to shoot stills or video whenever you want. The PowerShot SX260 HS also incorporates an electronic wind filter, which suppresses wind noise that can muffle or distort the sound. And unlike less sophisticated point-and-shoot cameras, the PowerShot SX260 HS lets you use the full range of optical zoom when youâ€™re shooting a video.

HDTV PLAYBACK VIA HDMI OUTPUT AND CEC
Itâ€™s easy to enjoy and share the videos you shoot with the PowerShot SX260 HS. Simply connect its HDMI terminal to your HDTV using an HDMI cable. And because the PowerShot SX260 HS supports HDMI-CEC technology, youâ€™ll be able to control the playback of your images and videos on any CEC-enabled HDTV using the TVâ€™s remote control. (CEC – Consumer Electronic Control – is part of the HDMI specification, enabling components in a system to communicate with one another.)

IFRAME 
With the PowerShot SX260 HS, you can also shoot video in the AppleÂ® iFrame format, which is a computer-friendly standard that speeds up importing and editing of videos. It keeps file sizes small, making it more convenient to upload or e-mail high-quality videos. The iFrame format enjoys native support in compatible Mac and Windows video applications, making it unnecessary to perform time-consuming and often quality-degrading conversions.

A SMARTER CAMERA MEANS BETTER PHOTOS
SMART AUTO
Smart AUTO for the PowerShot SX260 HS has been significantly expanded, making it easier than ever to capture the sharp, bright, colorful images – and videos – youâ€™re looking for. By assessing various factors in both the background and the subject, the system recognizes 58 predefined shooting situations and automatically selects the camera settings that will yield the best possible results. Simply frame the shot you want, and in dozens of common or challenging scenarios the camera takes care of the rest. Hard-to-capture shots such as moving subjects, night scenes, backlit subjects, and landscapes at evening or on a bright snowy day are instantly and effortlessly captured as â€œkeeperâ€ shots. Smart AUTO makes the PowerShot SX260 HS ideal for capturing excellent quality still images and video on the go.

SHOOTING MODES/SPECIALN SCENE MODES
Manual You have complete control of exposure, selecting both aperture and shutter speed manually. Aperture-priority You set the aperture, controlling depth-of-field. The camera automatically selects the shutter speed. Shutter-priority You select the shutter speed, and the camera automatically selects the appropriate aperture. Program The camera automatically and intelligently selects the aperture/shutter speed combination based on the shooting conditions. Live View Control Enables Brightness, Color, and Tone adjustments to your images using easy-to-understand controls. Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Easy Easy mode, shooting is simple and relaxed the camera handles all the settings automatically. Movie Digest in 720p HD Records a video clip in 720p HD before capturing a still image and then combines one day's worth of clips into a video. Portrait Brings the subject into focus while beautifully blurring the background. Smooth Skin Removes dullness, wrinkles, and harsh shadows for beautiful faces. Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. High-Speed Burst HQ Captures fast-action shots at full resolution, providing continuous shooting when the shutter button is held down. Handheld Night Scene Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod. Low Light For high quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly lit situations. Underwater Capture underwater images with reduced backscatter effect. Optional Underwater Case required. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Create brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Stitch Assist Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos. Creative Filters This setting provides easy access to special filter effects and scene modes, such as Toy Camera Effect, Poster Effect, Monochrome and more. Fisheye Effect Now you can get the fisheye effect – a classic photographic distortion – without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect for Stills & Video Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with toy or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Soft Focus Creates a hazy ambiance that's perfect for portraits and wedding photos. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome. Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects. Discreet Mode Disables flash, AF assist beam, and all camera sounds with one mode dial setting so you can capture images in quiet areas. iFrame Movie The Apple® movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality. Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion. 
FACE ID
Face ID is one of the most advanced and exciting new features of the PowerShot SX260 HS, giving you an easy way to improve every shot of the people you love. Simply take a picture of up to 12 faces you would like the camera to register, then enter names and ages. Once a person is registered, the camera will pick him or her out of a group (even against a busy background) and adjust focus and exposure to his or her face, even recognizing faces in profile. Face ID is particularly great for shots of babies and children. The system can pick your baby out of a group of children, focus on your baby when pictured with an adult, and capture her best smile by taking three successive images when the smile is detected. The flash is even disabled so as not to startle the baby and interrupt the moment. Older children in motion are tracked, with focus and exposure continually adjusted with Servo AF; with one shutter press three successive images are captured so the best shot is never missed. And because you'll identify each face you register, Face ID makes it easy to search images by name.

A STEADY IMAGE IS A BEAUTIFUL IMAGE
INTELLIGENT IS
The latest advance in Canon Optical Image Stabilization technology, Intelligent IS analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes. With Intelligent IS, you can concentrate on image capture, letting the camera make the most effective IS settings to assure the steadiest possible image.

Normal Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills.

Panning Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement.

Macro (Hybrid) Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting.

Dynamic Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking.

Powered Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified.

Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed.


THE IDEAL TRAVELING COMPANION
GPS TECHNOLOGY
The PowerShot SX260 HS digital camera is equipped with Global Positioning System (GPS)* technology. Now you can travel the world and let the camera automatically record the locations and local times of your stills and videos. The camera can also use the GPS unit to automatically set the exact time. You can maximize the usefulness of the GPS feature by using the special bundled Map Utility software that makes it fun to share the memories of your world adventures. In addition to displaying all your photos' locations on a world map, the camera's GPS system can also track your route from photo to photo – a great way to visualize each trip! You can also create and share custom maps and personal mini-travel guides with friends and family members.
*In certain countries and regions, the use of GPS may be restricted. Therefore, be sure to use GPS in accordance with the laws and regulations of your country or region. Be particularly careful when traveling outside your home country. As a signal is received from GPS satellites, take sufficient measures when using in locations where the use of electronics is regulated.
This software uses Google Maps for displaying maps.

VERSATILE STILL AND VIDEO SHOOTING OPTIONS
HIGH-SPEED BURST HQ
Utilizing the increased processing speed and power of the new Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor, High-Speed Burst HQ makes it possible to capture fast action stills at full resolution during continuous shooting. The results are exceptionally high-quality images recorded in rapid sequence. In this mode, the PowerShot SX260 HS can capture a maximum of 10 shots in a single burst.*

TURN YOUR MEMORIES INTO A HIGHLIGHTS REEL
720P MOVIE DIGEST
With the PowerShot SX260 HS digital camera, capturing trips and special occasions with a high-quality video highlights reel is as easy as switching on the Movie Digest feature. When activated, the feature automatically records the four seconds before each still shot as video, then auto-edits them into a short movie. Played back together, the video clips capture the mood and ambiance of special days in a way that's completely different from still images, both documenting the creation of still images and providing a unique stand-alone memory preserver. New with the PowerShot SX260 HS, the video is captured in 720p high definition so that it looks smooth and beautifully detailed when played back on your HDTV. With bundled software ImageBrowser EX, you can easily delete any scenes you don't want.

PICK YOUR COLOR
AVAILABLE IN 3 COLORS
The camera's silky-smooth coating provides a luxurious feel and radiates a deep, subtle sheen. And the fact that PowerShot SX260 HS is packed with serious specs and technological advancements doesn't mean you're limited to basic black: your color choice is as individual as the images you'll create. Choose from black, red and green.
